website_summaries.verdict: An effective night guard without the costly dentist visit. The material is a bit firm, but it's thin, durable, and easy to customize.
pros: Diffusix technology is thin, yet it effectively absorbs bite impact
Can be molded up to 20 times
Breathable design enables drinking while wearing
cons: It's stiffer than some competitors and may be uncomfortable for some users
Works best on the top teeth

customer_reviews.title: Beware!! This mouth guard is very difficult to fit in your mouth. Can Not Return!!
customer_reviews.text: I normally do not write reviews but this mouth guard is an exception. It is almost impossible to do the initial fitting into your mouth top or bottom teeth. If you don't get it right the first time it gets more and more difficult to work with. Finally after around 5 tries it is no longer workable at all. Don't waste your money and patience. It is NOT returnable so you are stuck with it. I bought a Den Tek mouth guard and got it setup the first time and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Mcewan

customer_reviews.title: A very nice mouthguard to be sure
customer_reviews.text: A very nice mouthguard to be sure, the fitting instructions were clear and worked well. I would say this guard is as close to a custom dentist-fit guard as you can get without making an appointment. To those with smiles that don't "seat" very well (meaning you can rest your teeth at different points), you may prefer another mouthguard that has a flat bottom - this guard conforms fully to your top teeth and I found myself expecting a flat bottom mouthguard for my bottom teeth to rest on. This is all personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Matt R.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to fit and hard as a rock
customer_reviews.text: Cant get a good fit to save my life. Doesnt matter how gently I press it on, once it's completely cooled off it's still too tight and makes my teeth sore. Also it's hard as a rock. Love how thin it is but cant get it to fit right and makes my teeth sore
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Hallelujah
customer_reviews.text: Hallelujah, a cheap night guard I could mold to my uppers. Lightweight and perforated. Much better than the expensive, tight guards for my lowers that I kept getting from the dentist. No issues molding, thought the water really needed to be above 140 degrees, maybe 150? And I'm not going to win a 'beautifully molded bite guard' contest, but it works for me. Been using for a few nights now and the achy jaw feeling is going away. Life is good again.
customer_reviews.author: EOH

customer_reviews.title: I've FINALLY found a reasonalby priced guard that I can tolerate in my mouth!
customer_reviews.text: This think is a little miracle! I have tried several other 'mold your own' guards to help with bruxism, but they are always super bulky and almost make me gag. This is so EASY to mold and feels great...almost like nothing in your mouth at all! I don't think the $600 guard my dentist tried to sell me would have been any better. I hope these continue to be available because they are fantastic! If you need to protect your teeth and don't want to pay a fortune....get one of these and give it a try. I just can't see how anyone could be disappointed with this.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Waking up with massive headaches, sore jaw, swollen lymph nodes and a chipped tooth I finally realized I clench my jaw at night lol Went on the search for a guard, this is my second. First one I didn't care for, it was bulky and a pain to mold. I'm incredibly happy with SOVA! It was super easy to mold, messed up the first time and easily remolded it. Super light weight and can barely feel it in my mouth. I like that it's one side too, found the guard with upper and lower to be annoying. I no longer dread putting in my night guard before I go to bed thanks SOVA!
customer_reviews.author: alicia gallo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to form but the instructions are inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Easy to form but the instructions are inaccurate. It took hot water at about 160 f to get it softened. You can tell when it is ready because it becomes clear. I used my tongue to get it properly seated on the second run. The instructions say to use your thumbs. Did not work so well so had to redo. Redoing is easy with no damage to the material. I wear it nightly. Best mouth guard ever.
customer_reviews.author: Kat D

customer_reviews.title: Freaky tight on teeth
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouthguard with the intent of using it to put a stop to my habit of chewing on the inside of my mouth. I found it impossible to get the thing into my mouth without it getting folded in on itself at the back of my mouth. Then I got freaked out at how tightly it sticks to your teeth, even though I was being very careful to bite loosely on it while it was molding. I did not think I was going to be able to get the thing out of my mouth. It may work for some people, but it sure didn't work for me!
customer_reviews.author: Missouri Girl

customer_reviews.title: Made my wife's teeth hurt
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife as she grinds her teeth nightly. The day we got the guard, we probably went through about 7 or 8 molding attempts before she was at a decent comfort. She wore it throughout the entire night, but in the morning, she woke up with her front teeth really sore. The soreness probably lasted a couple of days. Unfortunately, this didn't work out for her and she went to the dentist to get the custom fitted guards. I'm given thing two stars because this guard molds really easy when heated.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C

customer_reviews.title: Better than the others
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky to form- got it on the 3rd try. Helps to watch the video several times and follow instructions exactly- (don't bite down too hard, it makes holes). At night, I don't even know I'm wearing it- and it doesn't come loose/fall off like the other softer ones. However though it's improved- I still have some jaw pain. I'm going to try getting one for my lower teeth as well and see if it helps more. Overall, I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for dental visit
customer_reviews.text: works very well. This is an excellent substitute for the expensive mouth guards you get from the dentist. Not the easiest thing in the world to mold, but once you get it right it is a game changer. Just get someone to help you make sure it is aligned properly in your mouth before you bite down. I would highly recommend this product. I have just been letting mine soak in mouthwash daily for cleaning. Not sure if that is the right thing to do or not.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas A Young

customer_reviews.title: Not effective as night guard
customer_reviews.text: The fitting is impossible to have a smooth uniform surface. This will cause a perfect place for bacteria to grow, and tartar to form (the hardened byproduct of bacteria). It is thin so it does not replicate the space between your upper and lower jaw at rest (the purpose of a night guard) you are not going to be able to have canine guidance, which is a very slight ramp from the canine that will keep the posterior teeth from touching when the jaw slides from side to side. It will probably work for a night in a pinch. This is not effective as a night guard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Hard
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to replace a Dentek mouthguard. The Dentek was comfortable overall but extended into the roof of my mouth and i thought something thinner would be more comfortable. During molding my top and bottom teeth are very close in the front and my lower teeth tore the guard so i am not attempting to remold. The guard seems to shrink when it cools, is pretty tight when i place in my mouth and is something i am not getting used too. It feels like I have a credit card in my mouth and has annoyed me to the point that i pull it out in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: John Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Superior and simple product
customer_reviews.text: Based on my past experience with night guards I was extremely surprised at how well this worked for me! I think part of the reason is the thinness. Usually I go back to my dentist at least 3 times to have my guard fitted better - very sensitive jaw to the point where my jaw trembles if the guard isn't perfectly fitted to my bite. NO problems with this one! Couldn't believe it. Just wanted to give it a try to save $300. Glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: J. Sucre

customer_reviews.title: Go to the dentist and get a real night guard...
customer_reviews.text: I am old and remolded this like seven times in 30 minutes. It was way too big for my mouth, and when I cut it it made it worse, it wouldn’t stay over my teeth and mold to them evenly. One side was way up on the inside of my gum on the other side was way up on the outside and it was just a mess. It made my TMJ even worse trying to fit that damn thing in my mouth. It’s worth $500 to go to the dentist and get one done right instead of trying to screw around with one by yourself. I threw it in the trashcan.
customer_reviews.author: DMSN1220Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best mold-to-fit guard I've found
customer_reviews.text: Five months in the guard is holding up well. I'm a heavy grinder and chewed through most softer guards within weeks, even managing to crack a hard, acrylic guard made by a dental lab. The SOVA was easy to fit and then make some minor tweaks by immersing it in hot water again. I easily got a comfortably snug fit that prevents the guard from coming loose while I sleep. Although the material is hard, the way it conforms to the contours of your mouth makes it quite comfortable. Update: I've now used the guard for 18 months and it's still in good condition. Its somewhat higher price than other guards is more than compensated for by its longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Paule

customer_reviews.title: Easy to custom fit and re-fit if done wrong the first time.
customer_reviews.text: These night guards are moldable. If you don't get it right the first time, submerse in hot water again and re-fit. Turns rigid as it cools. Most comfortable of any over-the-counter guard I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: tonys66ca

customer_reviews.title: Great mouth guard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sova Aero as a back up to the mouth guard I purchased from my dentist. The mouth guard was easy to mold and turns translucent in color when it is warm enough to shape. I was able to dip one area in hot water to reshape. Mouth guard stays in place, and the perforations help to make it feel more natural. It does feel tight when you initially insert it but it is comfortable to wear. I have used the other melt and form that are thicker and they often are too heavy and are hard to use. I am planning to order a second one as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Better than most guards...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouth guard. However, I had to mold it 5 times just to get the right fit. They say you can re-mold it up to 20 times. But I found that after the 3rd time of dipping and molding, it started to loose its quality a little. So I ordered a back up from Sova directly (Amazon is cheaper). Now I'm more familiar with the product and even better, my headaches are getting better!
customer_reviews.author: T.C.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This arrived today and is unusable. I followed the directions step by step. They say to avoid letting the mouth guard over lap on itself. This is difficult to manage. The material turns clear and stretches out when ready to mold. They don't inform/warn you that the material sticks to items. I attempted using a fork and tongs. It stuck to both. This was difficult to get in my mouth for fitting. I saw some people say that they molded twice and the second mold helped secure a better fit. This was not the case. This just stretched the material out more and began to rip. I would not waste the money or time on this product. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't comfortable for me.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first attempt at a mouth guard, but I didn't find it comfortable at all. Once it hardened, it was super uncomfortable for my lower teeth because the guard curves/cradles the upper teeth, and with that curve then the lower teeth don't have a flat surface to rest on. My lower gas/teeth slid from side to side trying to find a comfortable position to rest. I reshaped the mouth guard at least 4 times trying to make it work, but still had same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Riley

customer_reviews.title: Alternative to Dentist-Made Mouth guard
customer_reviews.text: A good alternative to the $400 mouth guard that my dog decided should be his chew toy. Unlike other store bought mouth guards, this one is not bulky and I do not spit it out in the middle of the night. It took me about four tries to get it fitted correctly but has been helping prevent the migraines I usually get from my TMJ.
customer_reviews.author: kmorgan81091

customer_reviews.title: Legitimate Product!
customer_reviews.text: 5stars! As someone else said - if someone is giving this a bad review, it’s likely because they did not follow the instructions! My wife and I were both told that we grind. Got one of these for both of us. Took two tries before we got the mold perfect. Very easy to form and dries hard. So far, it’s very comfortable. It’s not super thick which is good but might be a downfall. I’ve chipped my enamel on my teeth so I’m thinking I might be able to chew through this but hopefully not. If I do, I’ll try the thicker version next time. At any rate- a nice alternative to spending $300+ at the office.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cerutti

customer_reviews.title: LOVE SOVA
customer_reviews.text: This mouthguard is absolutely amazing! I grind my teeth horrendously to the point of causing full face pain and serious trouble eating. This mouthgaurd has eliminated those horrible after effects and allows me to sleep with piece of mind that I'm not further damaging my teeth. I prefer the SOVA to the one from my dentist fit for me due to the fact that the SOVA NIGHTGUARD has tiny air holes throughout the plastic, thus cutting down on the yucky morning breath that I experienced with my non-ventilated mouthguard from my dentist!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't started using it yet, but I must say the instructions are easy to follow. It isn't a huge guard so if you have a large mouth it may not work for you. It doesn't fully cover my last molars (don't have wisdom teeth), but it covers enough. I heated the water closer to 150 degrees or 65 C. You want the guard to be see through. Then I used my tongue and fingers to mold it around my teeth. Then I sucked really hard to help remove air for a better fit. After the 3 minute wait time it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bg

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Material and Hard to Fit in Small Mouth
customer_reviews.text: I should have been suspicious of 5-star raters who say not to listen to 1-star reviewers. What is their stake in this that they try to squelch low reviews? My wife (this is Jeff writing the review) worked for nearly an hour trying to get this shaped. But it is so thin that it quickly cools and hardens so it will no longer mold to the teeth. If you can get both hands and a foot or two in your mouth, like I seem to be able to do (LOL), then you might succeed with this mouth guard. Otherwise, this is probably going to be a struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy O'neal

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great. No boiling water
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. No boiling water, it just melts in very hot water and you can mold over and over and over. I can not stand having stuff in my mouth when I sleep. So as I layed there and kept salivating and swallowing, I kept thinking to myself, THIS WILL NEVER WORK and then I woke up this morning and it was still in my mouth and I slept all night. The nice part is, you form it so well, that you have to take it out with two hands, (like those invisible braces), so it does not move or fall around. GREAT PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Lucille Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Hurts my tongue in the back
customer_reviews.text: It took me awhile to fit it well, but luckily it's fine to rewarm it several times. However, where it ends on my molars, it ends up jutting out toward my tongue in a very uncomfortable way. I have tried to refit to get rid of this but it hasn't worked yet. Maybe my mouth is the wrong size....
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: pernament retainers think twice before you buy
customer_reviews.text: Good price but this product was very hard to form I tried top and lower and when I did form it was not at all comfortable. I have permanent retainers top and bottom and when I tried to wear it my bite did not feel right. I am going to have a night guard made by my dentist I spent to much time and money on braces. I have had the dentist make them years ago so I know how they should feel. This may work for some people but not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: The best night guard
customer_reviews.text: I grind my teeth very hard at night and I've tried several mouth guards. This one so far is the only one that is very comfortable and allows me to sleep through the night. It is thin, easily molded and sits perfectly on my top teeth. I hardly notice it there, unlike all the other ones which are extremely bulky and forces my mouth open.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Bouchard

customer_reviews.title: Great Hard Mouthguard
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a $1600 mouthguard. It was wonderful, until I accidentally flushed down the toilet. I’ve tried drug store mouth guards before but I needed a hard mouth guard. This one is just as good as the $1600 one, plus it’s remoldable. If you want a soft/chewy sports type guard, this is NOT for you. If you need something for bruxism (and you can talk and drink with this in) then definitely consider this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t let the laziness of others sway your opinion about this great product.
customer_reviews.text: It protects my teeth. Youva. Remold it as often as you want. I tried upper and lower teeth and found upper stays more secure. Just make sure it’s a good fit. If it’s not or causes irritation then remold it. People who have submitted poor reviews are lazy and are blaming their human error on an incorrect fit. The product is only as good as the amount of time you are willing to put into it. Think of it like a good baseball mitt. It takes time and then you will swear by it.
customer_reviews.author: Mellor Family

customer_reviews.title: False advertising, waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, some of the other 3 or more star reviews are hogwash! This product doesn't stand up to the advertised description nor the results. There isn't enough material to even make a complete mold. I followed the instructions to a tee, it didn't work! The material kept Harding faster than I could mold it. I ended up with a flat curved mess. I'm not happy! Waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Henry C

customer_reviews.title: Works just as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I tried a few others with no luck. This brand fit and performed exactly as advertised. When at the first try I didn’t get it fitted perfectly, I put it back in the warm water and did it again. Second time was a perfect fit. This has not slipped out at night and has been a God send for grinding and clenching problems that were seriously disturbing my sleep. My husband has asked for one now for himself. Can’t believe the great price on it. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: ladyofthelake

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I liked the concept for this guard but it's not the right product for me. I tried forming it once but I didn't get it right so I tried again. It was a little out of shape on the second try. I found that when I held it in place with my teeth I accidently left impressions of my lower teeth on the mouth guard. This caused my jaw to sit in an unatural position when I sleep. Very uncomfortable and I would end up taking it out while I slept. I'm sure others have no problem but it's not for me.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: In the trash on day 2
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for its thin 1.6mm profile. But a big mistake. It took hours of trial and error to get a somewhat decent fit. But the material hardened as it cooled, and and it felt like a rock between my upper and lower teeth. The product shrinks as it cools, it tightened up to a point where it hurt my teeth just pulling it out. I trashed the product on day 2, and got disposable mouth guard (which aren't good either, but software and better than this hard shell product). I've now ordered a different brand with softer and more flexible material. It could be a good buy for some, but it didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Stop grinding
customer_reviews.text: I loved this. I had to reheat and shake a couple times but it just requires hot water not boiling. Very hard so won’t grind through it. Thin enough I don’t hate it. Molds easily to your specific mouth. Fits like a glove. Can’t say how great this is for this issue. I liked that it is remoldable if you mess up or it’s not as comfortable as you want. Can even reshape later if have dental work done.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent would recommend to anyone with a grinding prob
customer_reviews.text: My fiancee used to keep me up grinding she has bruxism really bad and this mouth guard legit stopped her from grinding she had a acrylic mouth guard made from a specialist n she chewed right threw it cracked and all this makes it so she don't grind I'm sold
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for heavy grinder
customer_reviews.text: Watch the video located at the bottom of the Amazon page first!!! Perfect fit the first time after I watched the video. Pretty comfortable, and excellent value, I use in upper teeth and I have a dentist made guard for lower teeth$600, this is definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Danielle W.

customer_reviews.title: For best protection, have your dentist make a mouth guard.
customer_reviews.text: I've always paid for my dentist to make the custom mouth guards and I thought I would give this product a try and save some money, but you get what you pay for. This may work for some, but after several attempts trying to get this to fit right and not have my teeth sore in the morning after wearing it at night, I just went back to the dentist and had my custom one made that is a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Eric Spiess

customer_reviews.title: Better than my custom $600 night guard!
customer_reviews.text: Super thin, easy to fit, and durable. I grind through most in about a month. 3 months later and it is still going strong. My custom one from the dentist is too big and I have trouble sleeping with it. This one is no problem. I have formed it so it also works in place of my retainer. I will likely grind through it eventually but for the price and comfort I will gladly buy another when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t personally worth it .
customer_reviews.text: I really tried to like this product . I got it to fit fine and then later when I would go to put it on at night it’s like it kept hardening and my teeth were held firmly but in a position they shouldn’t be in. The product it’s self seemed nice , and it was easy enough to fit it but super uncomfortable. Unfortunately I can’t even return the product and now have to buy something else that will be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I was a little nervous and apprehensive to mold this to my teeth, however as long as you follow the instructions it was very easy and straightforward molded very easily to my teeth, I also followed instructions of another reviewer and molded it downwards to fit my bottom teeth instead of my top, and I absolutely love this so much more
customer_reviews.author: Kstrong

customer_reviews.title: The best mouth piece you will ever by.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of trouble finding a night guard that fits because I have a small mouth and my teeth are not straight. Thankfully I found this nightguard, I have had it since Jan. 2019 and I love it. It was easy to mold and is small enough for my mouth. I cut some pieces so they didnt fit to far over my gum and pinch me and its perfect. My dentist has seen significant improvement, no more broken teeth from grinding. I love this item.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Watch the video !!
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble getting the guard to mold right. I watched the video and it seemed pretty easy. After 12 tries I finally got a good fit. Will wear it tonight for the first time. I think the problem was me. It’s smaller than another one I bought so am hoping it works.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This Sova Aero night guard works well, kudos to their design team. I clench, apparently very hard and the product survives! I highly recommend this product to those who clench but not too hard. After a couple months though, one tooth got very upset about being pressed against. I had to revert back to my old one with a cushion. Your mileage may vary so give it a try. You must carefully follow the instructions for a good fit. It took me two tries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable and thin - love it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is seriously the best!! I had an old one that I got at a store, well known brand, and my dog chewed it up. This other brand changed the way they made it and it now has 2 layers. I can chew thru that first layer in a night. It also got thicker and I feel like I will gag. The Sova brand is awesome and I can get back to a good nights sleep!! You can remold it several times to get a good fit. It’s thin and I’ve had it a few weeks and haven’t chewed thru it. A define life saver!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Dog

customer_reviews.title: great mouth guard, great price
customer_reviews.text: I clench my jaw when I sleep and purchased the product to see if it'll help. I've never worn one and didn't want to spend a lot of $. It was easy to mold, instructions were very clear and simple. It took a couple of days to get used to and so far I've been using it for a couple of weeks and have no complaints or issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: lulu

customer_reviews.title: Never used it, but I could not return it.
customer_reviews.text: It seem that it would be hard to form. It does state on the box that it is good for 10 adjustments. I just went back to my older unit that was professionally made. Found out that other companies will send the mouthpiece and the paste to make the mouthpiece. When dried all I would need to do is to sent it to the manufacturer for detailing. It would cost 1/2 the cost my dentist would charge.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Petryshyn

customer_reviews.title: Not for night clenchers
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a night guard to prevent headaches from clenching your teeth while you sleep, look for something else. This is just too thin to really be effective.
customer_reviews.author: Tennyl

customer_reviews.title: Hard to mold to teeth
customer_reviews.text: Took several tries to get it to fit over my teeth without it hardening in a way that wouldn't cut my lip. Once I got it right it didn't work. It actually might be worse and I'm afraid to refit as the plastic has become very thin.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Just not for me
customer_reviews.text: Was pretty easy to get formed. I'm a heavy grinder at night and this guard was like grinding teeth on a brick. No shock absorbing cushion. I liked the size and discreetness but I would wake up in the middle of the night with jaw pain and my teeth hurt so bad. Maybe it's fine if you're not a heavy grinder but if you are, look for something with cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Heather M. Stoll

customer_reviews.title: So much cheaper than the dentists'
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad you can re-form it, it takes a few tries to get it right. The little holes are great to keep you from drooling all over yourself at night but if you don't mold it right they can cause a rough edge and gives mouth sores. Overall I really like it and if you can figure out how to mold it perfectly it's a great cheap alternative to the dentist.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Can wear these!
customer_reviews.text: I have had two mouth guards from dentists over the years and they are always too big and never made it through the night. This SOVA Aero is much thinner and as a result much more comfortable to wear all night long. Still strange for the first couple of nights but then no problems, sometimes I forget it's in when I get up. Definitely worth a try if you feel that other mouth guards are too big.
customer_reviews.author: JR's thoughts

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Decided to start using a night guard because I was clenching my teeth and cracking my fillings. Now that I've got them fixed, I'd rather not go through that again. It helps tremendously! My jaws aren't sore, and I sleep better. It might take a while to get used to, but I used to have braces/retainer so it doesn't bother me at all.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lyles

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best mouth guard if you grind your teeth. Very easy to fit and don't worry if you mess it up, it's very forgiving with multiple opportunities to improve the fit. Truly the best fit I've every had, and I've been using mouth guards for decades. The perforations are a game changer for comfort. The allow the guard to breath and for fluids to pass through, if you wear one today, you know why that's important. Will definitely by again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I have an extreme clenching problem and have been through several mouthguards over the years. I actually like this one better than the ones I have purchased from my various dentists over the years. I even keep a spare in my carry on just in case I would forget my guard because I cannot sleep without it. It may take you a couple of times to mold correctly, so be patient.
customer_reviews.author: S palm

customer_reviews.title: Great guard, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Even my dentist thinks this is a good deal. It is great because it can be remolded if you have dental work. It’s is my nearly as bulky as the one my husband paid $300 for through his dentist.
customer_reviews.author: twocrazy

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Works!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent best one I ever tried. Definitely works. Takes a few tries to get right fit, but it’s worth it. It’s thin too, which made it the only one I’ve tried that I can sleep In comfortably. Definitely helped my jaw pain after only one night of use. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michele C.

customer_reviews.title: Sorry, but this was a total waste for me
customer_reviews.text: You may have better luck with this product, but I found it impossible to fit to my mouth by following the directions, try as I might again and again. I have used other mouth guards that require similar molding prep and was hoping this slimmer model would feel betterin my mouth. My mistake! I went back to the old ones and have made peace with that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever
customer_reviews.text: I had been through guard after guard after guard, brand after brand after brand. Of course, the dentist version is the best but expensive. This is, by far, the best guard I have found... it is porous so your teeth and gums breath during the night leading to less plaque build up. Also, you can remold this thing several times until you have it just right. Lastly, it's thin! You don't feel like you have a football or boxing guard in your mouth. Closest to the dentist that I've found.
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: Adjusts multiple times, great with braces, worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: As a life-long night guard wearer, I was having issues finding a guard that would work with my adult braces. I tried several styles recommended by the orthodontist and finally found this. My ortho helped me form it the first time and showed me how to reform it after adjustments. I have reformed it 6 times (sometimes multiple times between adjustments) and have even switched from upper to lower. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Carin M. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Dental offices are recommending this brand.
customer_reviews.text: These work great if you don't have dental insurance and want to pay over $400 for a mouth guard. It has been working well and I don't even notice sleeping with it. It was a bit difficult to get it shaped to my teeth. I had to redo it several times but it held up just fine and I could do it easier the next time. Great value for price.
customer_reviews.author: husky87

customer_reviews.title: The best nightguard ever!
customer_reviews.text: For any price, this is the best nightguard ever. More comfortable than bulky expensive dentist office nightguards. Fit is easy and perfect. The holes allow saliva to move, so no drooling! My TMJ headaches are gone after 4 days of use. I can not say enough good things about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Happy shopper D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, easy to create, affordable Night Guard
customer_reviews.text: If you grind your teeth while sleeping and want an easy-to-make and affordable night guard solution, this is it! Excellent quality, comfortable and Sova's customer service is above and beyond amazing! Just follow the video and don't over-think it. The guard doesn't have to cover all your molars. Just follow the directions and video and in a few minutes you will have your perfect night guard without breaking the bank! Excellent. Love Sova
customer_reviews.author: laBelle

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I really like the concept of this night guard, it’s much thinner than previous ones meaning I can comfortably sleep with my mouth closed. However I found it to Be extremely hard to mold this to my teeth, especially without making it too tight. I still don’t think it’s loose enough even without sucking in on it AT ALL. It makes me feel like I’m wearing braces, it’s that stiff. Will not buy again, wish I hadn’t bought it to begin with
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Smallest mouthguard you'll find that does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to mold to your teeth, very thin, I highly doubt you could make anything smaller or thinner that would protect your teeth. That being said it is the perfect size for protecting your teeth and does exactly what it's supposed to do! I easily fell asleep with it in the first night.
customer_reviews.author: Prince

customer_reviews.title: Nice SOVA Aero 1.6mm Night Guard Custom-Fit
customer_reviews.text: I were happy to find a mouth guard that could be custom made at home to fit my teeth. The custom fit does take a few tries to get it to a satisfactory fitting. It does require you to mold quickly in front and back to have a smooth mold. Try not to mold too tight in the back because it will be painful.
customer_reviews.author: ClassicNFL

customer_reviews.title: Love this night guard!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing mouth guards at night for years. My current one broke and before spending hundreds of dollars with my dentist, I decided to first try a DIY mouth guard. And I am very happy I did. It was easy to fit and is very comfortable to wear. And the fact that you can re-mold it, if needed, took the pressure off getting it right the first time. Found it to be exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: Julie K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to mold.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to mold, but as I was used to using silicone protectors, I made the first mold very tight. I had headaches, but when I realized that it was due to the appliance, I turned the plate back to the hot water and remodeled my appliance. Now it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Sanches

customer_reviews.title: This product will change your bite
customer_reviews.text: The materiel used in this product is very temperature sensitive and shrinks while cooling. No matter how loosely you suction it in place, it will, inevitably, pull all of your teeth closer to the center of your palate when it cools. Don't do it. This product could easily end up costing you immensely in corrective dental bills.
customer_reviews.author: perspicua

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't mold
customer_reviews.text: I have used several brands of mouth guards with success. So far I have heated this one three time and can't get it to work. This is more expensive then most of the others.
customer_reviews.author: Bet Kolstad

customer_reviews.title: So happy I found this one!!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best drug store night guard you can buy! As long as you follow the directions you won’t have a problem molding it to fit your mouth. So happy I found this one! This saved me some serious money! Note: I watched the YouTube instruction video which helped!
customer_reviews.author: Nanci Z.

customer_reviews.title: Seems Quality, Hard to Mold
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this night-guard as a recommendation from my dentist a few years ago. The process of molding it is pretty straightforward, yet I had a difficult time getting a mold that I liked. It is remold-able, which is helpful. As the instructions note, if you suck too hard when waiting for it to harden (lol), it will be uncomfortable when you wear it afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Expired product
customer_reviews.text: Shipped in June of 2020. Sticker from manufacturer says “expiration: 6/18/2019” on the package. So I was sent an expired product. Also notes “MFG: 10/18/2016” (AKA the package I was sent was almost 4 years old). I’ve used similar night guards in the past and they work great once you figure out how to actually get them fitted! However, I would prefer NOT to use this one which apparently expired a year ago. Tried to return it/exchange for a not expired one but Amazon would not allow me.
customer_reviews.author: Sloane B

customer_reviews.title: Good as dentist night guard but less expensive
customer_reviews.text: The material is more like a pro dentist guard but at a lesser cost. I needed a guard but could not afford the one from a dentist. I bought one that I liked and was suggested by a hygienist friend but I quickly and easily bit through. Sova was easy to fit and seems to be more rugged. It says it can be reformed but I have not done this although I might.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: love the concept, but didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I had a tooth that was getting irritated by my biting down on it at night, it must be a little high. I tried this guard, but because it was thin and hard, I still bit down on my tooth while wearing it. I had to switch to a softer night guard.
customer_reviews.author: Falyn L.

customer_reviews.title: Could not get good fit, unimpressed.
customer_reviews.text: Could not get a comfortable fit after several hours worth of attempts. Product shrinks as it cools and dries and despite loosely fitting when warm it dries to an uncomfortable hard fit. And it's not refundable / returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Hard night guard
customer_reviews.text: I am finding this night guard difficult to get use to after using soft night guards. I do like the thickness but would like more flex. Still adjusting to it. It took several attempts to fit it to my mouth but at least it was easy to redo.
customer_reviews.author: David in Albuquerque

customer_reviews.title: Caused my tongue to burn
customer_reviews.text: Fits great after following instructions, but I fell asleep with this and then woke up with an extreme burning sensation on the tip of my tongue a few hours later. The next day, I used a dremel to cut away the plastic where the tip of my tongue was touching, and used it the next night only to wake up with the sides of my tongue burning. I'm guessing that I'm allergic to whatever type of plastic this is. Otherwise it could be due to the holes in the plastic creating friction on my tongue. Not sure, but this was a waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: SLentz

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: This lasted me a good year and a half which is impressive given that it's so thin and I grind my teeth all night long. Having crowns is worth 30 bucks a year so I'm ordering my second guard today. I like that the low profile of this guard doesn't make my jaw sore in the morning like the gel mouth guards tend to do.
customer_reviews.author: juan ovakyn

customer_reviews.title: Do listen to bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: I also followed instructions with a digital thermometer. It would not mold to the front of my teeth. When I tried again with water at 135 degrees it simply spread out when I bit down but would not even bend upward. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Anna

customer_reviews.title: The only mouth guard I've used (bruxism)
customer_reviews.text: I use these for nocturnal bruxism. I grind and clench. I've never ground through one, but I do consider myself a lightweight in the bruxism games, so take that statement with a grain of salt. I like how easy they are to reshape if your first attempt (or 4th!) to mold isn't quite right.
customer_reviews.author: Mardechel

customer_reviews.title: Great Night Guard. Helped my TMJ and wisdom tooth pain
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It's super light and comfortable. I had to mold it twice because the first time was not centered. But after getting it right the second time, it started helping my TMJ pain by the second night. I used to have braces too and stopped wearing my retainer so the night guard doubles as a retainer for my top teeth now. Overall though, I'm really glad I gave the Sova guard a try. It's an essential for me now.
customer_reviews.author: Rabz

customer_reviews.title: Siso night guard is a no go.
customer_reviews.text: I wish that I had a better review, but this product just did not work for me. The guard is very bulky and not flexible. Very hard to work with if you have a narrow jaw. To date, I have yet to properly fit this product after many attempts. Wish I could get my money back😞
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Gambone

customer_reviews.title: but this one has been amazing. Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I was upset when I found out I'd have to wear a night guard for TMJ, but this one has been amazing. Cheap, easy to shape, and I can barely feel it after a few minutes. It's easy to keep clean and has helped my TMJ so much. I would recommend this night guard to ANYONE with TMJ.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Not easy. Not easy to fit.
customer_reviews.text: Works great if you get it right. I just ordered another one. Too much hot water will ruin it. Easily $25mistake. Could be an easier set up. I just through $25 away because it did not set up right. I can’t afford to make mistakes. I have a huge problem with TMJ. The first one I got is so old it taste weird. I thought I would replace it. Fail. 🙁
customer_reviews.author: Karen court

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase, several holes as shown in picture
customer_reviews.text: I would not purchase this. It's very thin. I had to reshape it twice before using it then attempted to reshape again after wearing it & it ripped. And I spent $25 & now I'm out the cost as it's not returnable or replaceable fr vendor. Definitely a disappointment. You're better to get one fr drugstore.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to expensive retainers
customer_reviews.text: Rivals the $400 retainer my orthodontist gave me years ago. Not quite as comfortable, and who knows if it will last as long, but it's certainly a good buy. Molding it correctly took a few time, but once it's in place this mouth guard is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: K. Shea

customer_reviews.title: It was a complete disaster for me to use this night guard
customer_reviews.text: This night guard caused so much of discomfort in my denture while in use so that I could not sleep one full night (the first night I used it) and on second night, I had to remove it in the mid of night as again I found it difficult to sleep due to discomfort. The initial molding process was easy and steps given in the documentation were clear and sufficient; but after some time of molding, while it was in my mouth, the guard got so hard that it started putting pressure at few different points on the jaw. And to my amusement, there is no return policy also for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Magan Pal Singh

customer_reviews.title: Best over the counter night guard
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best night guard I have ever had. A proper fit is essential, but, once you get it right, it works like a champ. I will buy a back up. Also, my wife said she will be replacing her very expensive night guard from the dentist with this guard, when hers wears out. A++++
customer_reviews.author: SDMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Get this! The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and thin. The best for grinding. I do not like the holes in it, they hurt my tongue, but I have tried so many mouth guards and this one is slim and easy to mold and it helps more than the expensive one my dentist made for me. I will be buying more of these if this one wears out, but it seems pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low quality material
customer_reviews.text: This product didnt last the fitting. The material is way too thin. I was hoping to get my son wear this at night for his bruxism or teeth grinding but during the fitting, the molars made a whole in the material. I cant believe it! And you cant make a return.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, has a TERRIBLE taste
customer_reviews.text: The morphing process was pretty tedious. If you take your time though, the mouth guard will fit like a glove. It fits so perfectly, that I have no fear of it falling out in my sleep. The biggest problem is the taste. IT TASTES HORRIBLE, so bad that I can't sleep with it in. I am not sure what can be done to improve the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Kolnitys

customer_reviews.title: Well made, well fitting mouth guard
customer_reviews.text: This mouth guard delivered on all the key characteristics. Easy to custom fit, stays secure, is thin yet seems durable. All at a very affordable price. Definitely recommend if you grind your teeth at night and need a mouth guard.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Kaarlela

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for two months, and it works just as well as the one my dentist made. I suffer from very crooked teeth from deformed jaws, so being able to wear this on my straighter bottom is much more comfortable. This is also much thinner than the dentist made one. It took a bit to get the fit right. I also had to trim it after about a week, but now it's very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: This is truly the best nightguard!
customer_reviews.text: This is truly the best nightguard I have tried... and I have tried many. It is more comfortable than the dentist made guard and much more durable than the adjustable kind I have tried. It was easy to mold and fits just perfectly. I have bought this night guard at least 5 times now. Each one lasts me about 6 month (I’m a hard grinder). Try it, you won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Not as hard as you'd think
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what all the bad reviews are for. It was easy for me. Watch the video they refer you to in the instructions. I re-did mine twice. First time I bit down too hard but second time it was perfect. Hoping that it guards my teeth well when grinding in sleep. I paid 700.00 from a dentist and it sucked and was so tight and painful I cant wear it or simply put it in water to redo. Awesome product! FYI dont wash it with soap or the taste is horrible! Stick with toothpaste
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: couldn't use
customer_reviews.text: I may have just gotten a defective one, but After following all the instructions for molding, this product began disintegrating along the edges after it had hardened and the edges became jagged. I discarded it.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Silver

customer_reviews.title: Works surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: Works surprisingly well - easy to mold. Only complaint is that it's not long enough. Doesn't cover my back molars. Definitely worth a try before spending big bucks for a custom guard. I like that it's thinner than my custom dentist-made guard.
customer_reviews.author: Purdue Fan

product_meta.title: SOVA Aero 1.6mm Night Guard Custom-Fit Dental Mouth Guard, Mouth Guard with Case
product_meta.description: Style Name:Mouth Guard with CaseThe SOVA Aero Night Guard Custom-Fit Dental Mouth Guard provides protection against oral health issues—such as teeth grinding and clenching, and bruxism caused by TMJ—that can lead to headaches, damaged teeth and jaw pain. Made to withstand extreme chewing and grinding, the 1.6mm thick, ultralight SOVA guard is tougher than basic night guards, thanks to non-compressible, non-toxic materials that distribute force over the entire perforated surface of the mouth guard. One-of-a-kind Diffusix technology dissipates grinding forces, protecting against issues that can cause and perpetuate jaw pain, ensuring a better night’s sleep. The optimized design and perforation pattern promotes the natural flow of air and saliva, making it possible to breathe and drink easily while wearing the ultra-thin, odor and taste-free night guard. Customizable and remoldable up to 20 times, it’s easy to achieve the perfect fit without a costly trip to the dentist. The mouth guard is even compatible with braces, but a dental professional must be consulted for proper fitting. The SOVA Aero Night Guard is available with or without a ventilated carrying case, and is easy to clean using soap and water and/or toothpaste and a toothbrush. Made in the USA.
feature_bullets: SOVA Aero Night Guard mouth guard provides protection against nighttime teeth grinding and teeth clenching, jaw pain, and bruxism caused by TMJ
At just 1.6mm thick, the odor and taste-free guard promotes airflow, making it possible to breathe and drink while wearing
Diffusix technology’s engineered shape and perforations absorb impact and withstand extreme chewing, providing relief from headaches, damaged teeth, and jaw pain
Customizable and remoldable to ensure perfect fit and comfort for adults, without a visit to the dentist
Non-toxic mouthguard cleans easily with soap/water or toothpaste/toothbrush; comes with a ventilated carrying case

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars883 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
